Overview

The Senior Director, Fabric is responsible for overseeing the area of the business that supports the building of all fabric development from concept through approvals for Aeropostale, Nautica & Lucky brands. This position will strategically drive processes that will ensure a continuous flow of innovative fabrics within all categories and divisions.

Responsibilities

• Manage the fabric development team• Lead the strategic development of Fabric with initiating research and development of new seasonal trends in fabrics while supporting sustainability efforts across SPARC Brands related to fabric.• Build strong relationships with cross functional partners to develop long term strategies to achieve the goals of the business within the parameters of the calendar• Drive the fabric calendar on a seasonal basis to support the needs of Design in collaboration with Production on cost and lead times• Partner with cross functional teams (Production, Design, and Merchandising) to present and resolve issues in fabric development life cycle• Analyze the current processes and continue to find creative solutions to keep the fabric department in front of new initiatives and ideas• Mentor, train and develop the team• Lead & work closely with Compliance & Marketing team to manage & track all sustainability changes or updates related to fabric & marketing claims while keeping sourcing teams informed. • Negotiate fabric price & terms with mills on nominated fabrics.• Be the liaison with mills, vendors & sourcing team on any claims, issues as they arise related to fabrics

Fabric Development• Work with the Fabric Manager on communicating Design’s seasonal concepts on brand aesthetics and fabric trends with vendors and mills• Drive Fabric Manager to work continually on fabric development, sourcing, and serving as a bridge between Design and our vendor/mill partners to stay ahead of the trend curve, especially as it relates to sustainability. • Build a fabric matrix based on needs and capabilities and monitor the supplier’s performance to meet the brand requirements• Align and standardize the fabric from development through to production – build a library of standards/innovation• Managing & controlling Gold standards of running fabrics & refresh on a yearly basis.• Support sourcing team on all VOS fabric development to meet Gold standard or as per design intent.

Qualifications

• Strong knowledge of product development life cycle• Demonstrate technical knowledge of fabrics (constructions, yarn size/types, washes across knits and woven)• Ability to multi-task and shift priorities • Detail oriented and exhibits excellent follow up• Strong communication skills both written and verbal• Flexible, organized, team player who has the ability to work cross functionally and with vendors• Excellent time management skills• Proficiency in MS Office & PLM

• Travel may be required, based on business needs.• Adhere to regular in-office presence, including to engage in in-person team interaction, meetings and collaboration. Job duties may be performed effectively using the hybrid work program designated by the company.• Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor as the company retains the right to change duties to this position.• Must have authorization to work in the United States

Physical Requirements:• Ability to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards.• Ability to maintain regular and timely attendance consistent with the ADA, FMLA, and other federal, state and local standards and Company’s policy.• Ability to remain in a stationary position for up to 8 hours per day• Ability to constantly operate a computer, other office equipment and look at a monitor for up to 8 hours per day• Ability to clearly and accurately communicate and exchange information verbally, in writing, or through other means in person, telephonically, or through virtual communication methods• Ability to position self to reach at or below shoulder level• Ability to carry equipment, move boxes/samples, etc.

Requirements & EEO Statement
he salary range for this position is $125,000 to $150,000 annually Pay is based on several factors, including but not limited to position offered and work experience. In addition to your salary, SPARC Group, and its affiliated brands, offers a benefits package, including 401(k) plan, overtime pay, flexible work schedule and a generous employee discount program (all benefits are based on eligibility).
